Module lanat
Package lanat.utils

Interface ArgumentAdder

All Superinterfaces:
NamedWithDescription
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArgumentParser, Command, Group
public interface ArgumentAdder extends NamedWithDescription
An interface for objects that can add Arguments to themselves.

    • addArgument

      <Type extends ArgumentType<TInner>, TInner> void addArgument(@NotNull @NotNull Argument<Type,TInner> argument)
      Inserts an argument into this container.
      Type Parameters:
      Type - the type of the argument
      TInner - the type of the inner value of the argument
      Parameters:
      argument - the argument to be inserted

    • addArgument

      default <Type extends ArgumentType<TInner>, TInner> void addArgument(@NotNull @NotNull Builder<Argument<Type,TInner>> argument)
      Inserts an argument into this container. This is a convenience method for addArgument(Argument). It is equivalent to addArgument(argument.build()).
      Type Parameters:
      Type - the type of the argument
      TInner - the type of the inner value of the argument
      Parameters:
      argument - the argument to be inserted

    • getArguments

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull Argument<?,?>> getArguments()
      Returns a list of the arguments in this container.
      Returns:
      an immutable list of the arguments in this container

    • checkUniqueArguments

      default void checkUniqueArguments()
      Checks that all the arguments in this container are unique.
      Throws:
      ArgumentAlreadyExistsException - if there are two arguments with the same name

    • hasArgument

      default boolean hasArgument(@NotNull @NotNull String name)
      Checks if this container has an argument with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the argument
      Returns:
      true if this container has an argument with the given name, false otherwise

    • getArgument

      @NotNull default @NotNull Argument<?,?> getArgument(@NotNull @NotNull String name)
      Returns the argument with the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the argument
      Returns:
      the argument with the given name
      Throws:
      ArgumentNotFoundException - if there is no argument with the given name
